findings.title: _withdraw_ function has code repetitions and too many if/else statements
findings.description: The _withdraw_ function is prone to bugs due to code repetitions and excessive use of if/else statements, making it a potential source of errors.

findings.title: No function to remove a pool
findings.description: There is no function to remove a pool. New pool addition has to be carefully reviewed considering this issue.

findings.title: __startBlock_ and __halvingAfterBlock_ values are not being checked for correct values
findings.description: The constructor does not check if __startBlock_ value is bigger than the current block and __halvingAfterBlock_ value is bigger than the __startBlock_ value.

findings.title: _delegateBySig_ function does not check if the signer is the delegator
findings.description: The _delegateBySig_ function may result in delegating another address's voting power instead of the delegator if (nonce, expiry) is not the one that was signed.

findings.title: Timelock contract is not governed by an on-chain governance module
findings.description: The Timelock contract lacks a proper community-based on-chain governance module to administer its admin chain.
